name: num::nonzero::NonZero::<i8>::isolate_lowest_one

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

num::<impl i8>::wrapping_neg.doc:
Wrapping (modular) negation. Computes `-self`, wrapping around at the boundary
 of the type.

 The only case where such wrapping can occur is when one negates `MIN` on a signed type (where `MIN`
 is the negative minimal value for the type); this is a positive value that is too large to represent
 in the type. In such a case, this function returns `MIN` itself.

 # Examples

 ```
 ```

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::new_unchecke.doc:
Creates a non-zero without checking whether the value is non-zero.
 This results in undefined behavior if the value is zero.

 # Safety

 The value must not be zero.
